queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{prometheus-server}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{prometheus-server-configmap-reload}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-emqx}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-telegraf}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-telegraf}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-telegraf-operator}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{telegraf-operator}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-pushgateway}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pushgateway}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-main}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-ui}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-emqx-agent-download-proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-emqx-agent-download-proxy}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-main}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-main}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-telegraf-operator}}.rules[0].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-telegraf-operator}}.rules[0].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{prometheus-server}}.volumeMounts.name={{config-volume}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.volumeMounts.name={{dshm}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-main}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-main}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-emqx}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-telegraf}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-telegraf}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-main}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-ui}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

metadata.name={{release-name-kube-ecp-stack-emqx-agent-download-proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{emqx-ecp-emqx-agent-download-proxy}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-telegraf-operator}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{telegraf-operator}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to port-forward into pods can open socket-level communication channels to containers. In case of compromise, attackers may abuse this for direct communication that bypasses network security restrictions

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-clusterissuers}}.rules[2] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-clusterissuers}}.rules[2] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, update, delete) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-orders}}.rules[5] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-orders}}.rules[5] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges}}.rules[10] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges}}.rules[10] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-certificates}}.rules[4] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-certificates}}.rules[4] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, update, delete, patch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges}}.rules[3] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-challenges}}.rules[3] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-cainjector}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-cainjector}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-webhook:dynamic-serving}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-webhook:dynamic-serving}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, update) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role}}.rules[7] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-emqx-operator-manager-role}}.rules[7] is granted read access (verbs: create, get, list, patch, update, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-issuers}}.rules[2] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-cert-manager-controller-issuers}}.rules[2] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, update, delete) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Check if Deployment resources don't have a podAntiAffinity policy, which prevents multiple pods from being scheduled on the same node.
